meanings.definition: To break out or become active again, as a disease or conflict.
meanings.sent1: After a few days of rest, the flu recrudesced and made him feel sick again.
meanings.sent2: The old feud between the families recrudesced when they saw each other at the market.
meanings.sent3: The argument between the siblings recrudesced every time they tried to share the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room recrudesced, filling the air with unease.
meanings.sent5: The memories of the war recrudesced in his mind, haunting him with vivid images.

meanings.definition: To revive or reappear after a period of inactivity.
meanings.sent1: The flowers recrudesced in the spring, bringing color back to the garden.
meanings.sent2: His interest in painting recrudesced after he visited an art exhibition.
meanings.sent3: Her enthusiasm for the project recrudesced when she discovered a new approach.
meanings.sent4: The old tradition recrudesced in the town, sparking a sense of nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: Hope recrudesced in his heart as he saw the first signs of change.
